pageDescription: Learn how to use the platform based on your role

tenantGuide.title: Tenant Guide
tenantGuide.introduction: Welcome to the tenant guide! This comprehensive guide will help you navigate through the platform and make the most out of your rental experience. Learn how to manage your properties, submit maintenance requests, access important documents, and more.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: View details about your rented properties, including address, lease terms, and landlord contact information.

maintenance.title: Maintenance Requests
maintenance.description: Submit and track maintenance requests for your rental property.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Access and manage important documents related to your tenancy.

payments.title: Payments
payments.description: Make and track rent payments and view your payment history.

importantDates.title: Important Dates
importantDates.description: Keep track of important dates related to your tenancy.

utilities.title: Utilities
utilities.description: Manage and track utility usage and payments.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Communicate with your landlord or property manager.

propertyHandbook.title: Property Handbook
propertyHandbook.description: Access detailed information about your property.

tips.title: Tips for Getting Started
items: Complete your profile in the Settings page with all contact information
Set up your preferred payment methods before your first rent due date
Enable notifications to stay updated on important events and deadlines
Familiarize yourself with your lease terms and property rules immediately
Save your landlord's contact information for emergencies in your phone
Document the condition of your rental with photos when you first move in
Test all smoke detectors and safety equipment upon moving in

emergency.title: Emergency Procedures
emergency.intro: For urgent maintenance issues that require immediate attention:
steps: Use the emergency maintenance request option in the Maintenance section
Call your landlord's emergency contact number listed in your Property Handbook
For life-threatening emergencies (fire, gas leak), contact emergency services (911) first
Document the issue with photos once it's safe to do so
Follow up with standard documentation through the platform once the emergency is addressed

landlordGuide.title: Landlord Guide
landlordGuide.introduction: Welcome to the landlord guide! This comprehensive guide will help you efficiently manage your properties, tenants, and financial transactions. Learn how to track rent payments, handle maintenance requests, create and manage leases, and optimize your rental business operations.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.description: Get an overview of your rental business with key metrics and insights.

propertyManagement.title: Property Management
propertyManagement.description: Add, edit, and manage your rental properties.

tenantManagement.title: Tenant Management
tenantManagement.description: Manage current tenants and process new tenant applications.

maintenanceManagement.title: Maintenance Management
maintenanceManagement.description: Handle maintenance requests and schedule repairs.

documentManagement.title: Document Management
documentManagement.description: Create and manage leases, contracts, and other documents.

financialManagement.title: Financial Management
financialManagement.description: Track rent payments, expenses, and generate financial reports.

tenantTurnover.title: Tenant Turnover
tenantTurnover.description: Efficiently manage the tenant turnover process.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices for Landlords
items: Keep property details and photos up-to-date to minimize vacancy periods
Respond to maintenance requests within 24-48 hours to improve tenant satisfaction
Document all tenant communications within the platform for legal protection
Review financial reports monthly to identify trends and opportunities
Stay informed about local rental regulations and update your policies accordingly
Set up automatic rent payment reminders to reduce late payments
Conduct regular property inspections to prevent major maintenance issues
Build relationships with reliable service providers for faster maintenance resolution
Use the document templates to ensure legally compliant leases and notices
Implement consistent screening processes for all tenant applications

legalCompliance.title: Legal Compliance Tips
legalCompliance.intro: Important considerations to maintain legal compliance:
items: Always use up-to-date, legally reviewed lease templates for your jurisdiction
Follow local laws regarding security deposit handling and interest payments
Adhere to fair housing laws in all advertising and tenant selection
Maintain proper records of all maintenance requests and completions
Provide required disclosures (lead paint, mold, etc.) before lease signing
Follow proper notice procedures for inspections and lease terminations
Consult with a local real estate attorney for specific legal questions

serviceProviderGuide.title: Service Provider Guide
serviceProviderGuide.introduction: Welcome to the service provider guide! This comprehensive guide will help you understand how to use the platform to manage your maintenance services, grow your business, and build strong relationships with property owners. Learn how to receive and complete job requests, manage your schedule, and get paid promptly.

profileManagement.title: Profile Management
profileManagement.description: Set up and manage your service provider profile.

serviceAreas.title: Service Areas
serviceAreas.description: Define the geographic areas where you provide services.

jobManagement.title: Job Management
jobManagement.description: Manage maintenance requests and ongoing jobs.

earningsManagement.title: Earnings Management
earningsManagement.description: Track your earnings and payment history.

scheduling.title: Scheduling
scheduling.description: Manage your availability and job schedule.

clientManagement.title: Client Management
clientManagement.description: Manage your relationships with landlords and property managers.

ratingsReviews.title: Ratings & Reviews
ratingsReviews.description: Build your reputation with positive client feedback.

businessAnalytics.title: Business Analytics
businessAnalytics.description: Track your performance and identify growth opportunities.

tips.title: Tips for Service Providers
items: Respond to job requests within 1-2 hours to maximize your booking rate
Keep your availability calendar up-to-date to avoid scheduling conflicts
Document your work with detailed before and after photos for each job
Provide clear, detailed estimates and stick to quoted prices whenever possible
Maintain professional communication with clients through the platform messaging
Ask satisfied clients to leave reviews immediately after job completion
Regularly update your skills, certifications, and service offerings
Offer preventative maintenance packages to create recurring revenue
Consider offering emergency services at premium rates if your schedule allows
Use the mobile app for real-time updates when on service calls

bestPractices.title: Professional Best Practices
bestPractices.intro: Maintain high professional standards with these best practices:
items: Always confirm appointments 24 hours in advance to reduce no-shows
Wear professional attire and carry identification on all service calls
Provide written estimates before beginning work for transparency
Clean up thoroughly after completing any job
Follow up after major jobs to ensure ongoing client satisfaction
Maintain proper licensing, bonding, and insurance at all times
Keep detailed records of all work performed for warranty purposes

emergency.title: Handling Emergency Requests
emergency.intro: Guidelines for responding to emergency maintenance requests:
steps: Emergency requests are highlighted in red on your dashboard
Aim to respond to emergency requests within 15-30 minutes
If you accept an emergency job, provide an estimated arrival time
Use the "On My Way" button in the app to notify the client when you're en route
Document the emergency situation with photos before beginning work
After resolving the immediate emergency, schedule follow-up work if needed

responses.properties: The Properties section allows you to manage your rental properties. You can view property details, upload photos, track maintenance issues, and manage lease information. Property owners can add new properties, while tenants can view details about their rented properties.
responses.maintenance: The Maintenance section helps manage repair requests. Tenants can submit new maintenance tickets with photos and descriptions. Landlords can review these requests, assign them to service providers, track status updates, and manage repair costs. The platform keeps a history of all maintenance activities for each property.
responses.payments: The Payments section handles all financial transactions. Tenants can pay rent, set up automatic payments, and view payment history. Landlords can track received payments, record expenses, generate income reports, and set up payment reminders. The system also provides receipts and financial summaries.
responses.tenants: The Tenants section helps landlords manage their tenants. You can view tenant profiles, contact information, lease details, and payment history. You can also invite new tenants to register, process lease renewals, and track tenant turnover. Tenants can view their own lease information and update their profiles.
responses.landlords: Landlords can manage properties, tenants, maintenance requests, and financial transactions through the platform. The dashboard provides an overview of rental activities, upcoming events, and financial summaries. Landlords have tools to track property performance, schedule inspections, and generate reports.
responses.documents: The Documents section stores all important files related to your rental business. This includes lease agreements, addendums, inspection reports, maintenance records, and other legal documents. Files can be uploaded, organized by property, and shared with relevant parties. Digital signing capabilities are also available for lease agreements.
responses.serviceProviders: Service Providers can manage their available services, rates, and business details. They receive maintenance requests from landlords, can communicate with property owners and tenants, track job status, and process payments for completed work. The platform helps service providers manage their schedule and build their reputation through ratings and reviews.
responses.settings: The Settings section allows you to customize your experience. You can update your profile information, change notification preferences, manage payment methods, and set your communication preferences. You can also configure financial settings such as currency and tax information.
responses.platform: This platform is a comprehensive property management solution designed for landlords, tenants, and service providers. It streamlines rental property management with features for lease management, maintenance requests, payment processing, document storage, and communication between all parties involved in the rental process.
responses.help: If you need assistance, you can use this AI assistant, check the role-based guides in the Platform Guide section, or contact support through the Help section. Each section of the platform also includes contextual help and tooltips to guide you through specific features.
responses.default: I'm your AI assistant for this property management platform. I can help you understand how to use any feature of the platform, navigate between different sections, and make the most of the available tools. Please ask about specific features or tasks you'd like to learn more about.
responses.greeting: Hello! I'm your property management assistant. How can I help you today with managing your properties, tenants, or maintenance requests?
responses.thanks: You're welcome! Feel free to ask if you have any other questions about the platform. I'm here to help you make the most of your property management experience.
responses.question: That's a great question. I'd be happy to help you find the information you need. Could you please provide a bit more detail about what specific feature or section of the platform you're interested in?
responses.paymentHowTo: To make or manage payments: 1) Navigate to the Payments section from the main dashboard. 2) For tenants: select 'Make Payment' and choose your payment method. 3) For landlords: you can track incoming payments, set up automatic reminders, and generate payment reports. 4) All users can view payment history and download receipts from the transaction list.
responses.maintenanceHowTo: To submit a maintenance request: 1) Go to the Maintenance section in your dashboard. 2) Click 'New Request' and select the relevant property. 3) Describe the issue in detail and add photos if possible. 4) Set the priority level and submit. You'll receive updates as the request is processed, and you can track the status in the Maintenance section.
